questions.text: Which of the following is a live vaccine:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

OPV Live Vaccines Killed vaccines Subunit vaccines Toxoid Protein Recombinant DNA Polysaccharide BCG IPV Diptheria Influenza Hep B Meningococcal ACWY Measles /MR / MMR Rabies vaccine Tetanus Typhoid Vi Rotavac Cholera – Dukoral Pneumococcal JE (SA 14-14-2) Pertussis Hib Yellow fever (17D) Killed plague vaccine Typhoral- Ty21a Killed influenza Live plague vaccine JE – Nakayama. Beijing strain Live influenza KFD vaccine Varicella vaccinePYQ OPV

questions.text: Which of the following vaccine is not advised in pregnancy:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

MMR Live vaccines are contraindicated in pregnancy. Live Vaccines BCG Measles /MR / MMR Rotavac JE (SA 14-14-2) Yellow fever (17D) Typhoral- Ty21a Live plague vaccine Live influenza Varicella vaccinePYQ OPV

questions.text: Vaccine-derived poliovirus outbreaks are mostly due to?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Type-2 virus The attenuated polioviruses in OPV can undergo genetic changes _during replication, and in communities with low vaccination coverage, it rarely results in vaccine-derived polioviruses (VDPV) that can cause paralytic polio. Most of the global cases due to VDPVs (97%) and VAPP (40%) are due to type-2 viruses. This necessitates the discontinuation of the use of type-2 components from OPV.

questions.text: Which is not a vaccine-derived poliovirus:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mvdpv VDPVs are divided into three categories as cVDPVs when evidence of person-to-person transmission in the community exists; Immunodeficiency-associated VDPVs (iVDPVs) are isolates from persons with primary immunodeficiencies. who have prolonged VDPV infections; and Ambiguous VDPVs (aVDPVs), which are either clinical isolates from persons with no known immunodeficiency or sewage isolates whose source is unknown

questions.text: A 2 months febrile male child comes to CHC. His vitals were within normal limits. On taking history came to know his parents came from rural to urban areas as a migrant laborers. The child was delivered at home and did not go under any immunization. So which all vaccine should be given to child?
questions.correct_answer: D. BCG, OPV-1,rota virus, IPV, pentavalent 1
questions.explanation:
Solution:

BCG, OPV-1,rota virus, IPV, pentavalent 1 At birth BCG, OPV-zero dose, Hep B-birth dose 6 weeks OPV-1, Pentavalent-1, Rota-1*, fIPV-1, PCV-1* IPV 3 rd dose 10 weeks OPV-2, Pentavalent-2, Rota-2* 14 weeks OPV-3, Pentavalent-3, Rota-3*, fIPV-2, PCV-2* 9 months Measles-1/MR-1, Vit A, JE-1*, PCV-B* 16-24 months DPT first booster dose, OPV-booster dose, Measles-2/ MR-2, JE-2* 5-6 years DPT second booster dose 10 & 16 years Td For pregnant woman Td-1: early in pregnancy Td-24 weeks after Td-1 Td-B: if pregnancy occurs within 3 years of the last pregnancy and 2 Td doses were received

questions.text: A male baby of 2-month-old was not given BCG vaccination at birth. What is the dose of BCG to be administered to this baby?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

0.1 ml 1 ml is the recommended dosage of BCG to be administered from the age of 1 month – 1 year.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. 0.05 ml is the recommended dosage of BCG to be administered at birth till 1 month of age. Option: C. 0.5 ml is the dosage for PCV, Hep B, Pentavalent, MR, JE, and TT vaccines. Option: D. 1 ml is not the recommended dosage for any vaccine in the UIP schedule.

questions.text: The Hepatitis B vaccine has to be administered to a newborn baby at the hospital. Which of the following is the site of injection in the Hepatitis B vaccine?
questions.correct_answer: A. Antero-lateral side of mid-thigh – LEFT
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Antero-lateral side of mid-thigh – LEFT Antero-lateral side of mid-thigh – LEFT is the site of injection in Hepatitis B vaccination. The same site is used for the Pentavalent vaccine, which is given intramuscularly.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. PCV is given as an intramuscular (IM) injection in the anterolateral side of the mid-thigh Right. Option: C. BCG is given as an intradermal injection in the left upper arm. JE vaccine is given as a subcutaneous injection in the left upper arm – Deltoid. DPT's second booster is given as an intramuscular injection in the left upper arm. Option: D. Measles Vaccine is given as a subcutaneous injection in the right upper arm.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines uses Magnesium chloride as a stabilizing agent?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

OPV Stabilizers are compounds added to vaccines to provide stability and maintain immunogenicity. Oral Polio Vaccine is a suspension of type 1 and 3 and is supplied with a stabilizing agent - magnesium chloride.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Aluminium hydroxide is used as an adjuvant, and Thiomersal is used as a preservative in DPT. The primary purpose of Thiomersal has been to prevent microbial growth in the product during storage and use. The purpose of aluminium hydroxide in the vaccine is to increase the potency and reduce the tendency to cause a reactTION C – BCG is given as an intradermal injection in the left upper arm and uses Sodium Chloride as diluent. Option: D. Measles Vaccine is given as a subcutaneous injection in the right upper arm.

questions.text: A child of 9 months old comes to the PHC in Hooghly district of West Bengal for vaccination. Which of the following is the site of injection in the JE vaccine?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Upper Arm – LEFT JE vaccine is given as a subcutaneous injection in the left upper arm – Deltoid. BCG is given as an intradermal injection in the left upper arm. DPT's second booster is given as an intramuscular injection in the left upper arm.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Antero-lateral side of mid-thigh – LEFT is the site of injection in Hepatitis B vaccination. The same site is used for the Pentavalent vaccine, which is given intramuscularly. Option: B. PCV is given as an intramuscular (IM) injection in the anterolateral side of the mid-thigh Right. Option: D. Measles Vaccine is given as a subcutaneous injection in the right upper arm.

questions.text: An urban slum was identified in Delhi for Mission Indradhanush 2.0 immunisation programme. An infant of 11 months old has not been vaccinated except for BCG and OPV. What are the vaccines recommended for this baby?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above Rota vaccine, IPV, Pentavalent, and BCG are the 4 vaccines that can be given up to 1 year of age, beyond which is not recommended.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Two fractional doses of IVP are given intradermally at 6 and 14 weeks of age and can be given at one year. Option: B. Three doses of the Rota vaccine are given at 6, 10, and 14 weeks of age and can be given at one year. Option: C. Three doses of Pentavalent are given at 6, 10, and 14 weeks of age and can be given till one year of age. The 2nd and 3rd doses are given 4 weeks apart for this baby.

questions.text: A boy of 4 years old has not taken the DPT booster dose till now. What is the maximum age till which DPT can be given?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

7 years DPT is a combined vaccine. DPT 1st dose is given at 16-24 months of age, and DPT 2nd booster dose is given at 5-6 years of age. DPT can be given up to 7 years of age. DPT's first booster is given as an intramuscular injection in the anterolateral side of the mid-thigh in the left leg. DPT's second booster is given as an intramuscular injection in the left upper arm.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Two fractional doses of IVP are given intradermally at 6 and 14 weeks of age and can be given at one year. Option: C . Three doses of Rotavirus vaccine are given at 6, 10, and 14 weeks of age and can be given at one year. Option: D. Three doses of Pentavalent are given at 6, 10, and 14 weeks of age and can be given till one year of age. The 2nd and 3rd doses are given 4 weeks apart for this baby.

questions.text: A baby of 6 weeks was brought by a mother for routine vaccination at your PHC. What is the route of administration of PCV under the Universal Immunisation Programme?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Intramuscular PCV stands for Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine. The vaccine is given in two primary doses at 6 & 14 weeks, followed by a booster dose at 9-12 months. PCV is given as an intramuscular (IM) injection in the anterolateral side of the mid-thigh Right. It should be noted that the pentavalent vaccine and PCV are given as two separate injections into opposite thighs. The other vaccines given as intramuscular (IM) injections are Hepatitis B, Pentavalent, DPT booster, and TT.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. MR and JE are the vaccines that use a subcutaneous route of administration. MR is given as a subcutaneous injection in the right upper arm. Live attenuated JE vaccine is given as a subcutaneous injection in the left upper arm. Option: B. IPV and BCG are the vaccines that use the intradermal route of administration. BCG is given at birth or as early as possible till 1 year of age as an intradermal injection in the left upper arm. Two fractional doses of IVP are given intradermally at 6 and 14 weeks of age and can be given at one year. Option: D. Rotavirus, OPV, and Vitamin A are the vaccines that use the oral route of administration.

questions.text: Mission Indradhanush 2.0 was planned on a PHC area endemic for Japanese encephalitis. A survey was undertaken, and it was found that 30 babies were due for JE vaccination. What is the strain used in the JE vaccine?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

SA-14-14-2 JE vaccine is a cell-culture-based, live attenuated vaccine (SA-14-14-2) given as a subcutaneous injection in the left upper arm. It is given in select districts endemic to JE. JE vaccine is given in two doses first dose is given at 9 completed months-12 months of age and the second dose at 16-24 months of age.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. RA 27/3 vaccine strain grown in human diploid cell cultures is used in the Rubella vaccine. Option: C. Bacillus Calmette–Guérin (BCG) vaccine is primarily used against tuberculosis (TB) and uses the Danish 1331 strain. Option: D. Yellow Fever Vaccine, for subcutaneous use, is prepared by culturing the 17D-204 strain of yellow fever virus in living avian leukosis virus-free (ALV-free) chicken embryos.

questions.text: A survey on vaccine dropouts was taken in a PHC in West Bengal. A total of 25 children were found since the area involved a migratory population. 10 children were in the age group 10- 15. What vaccines are eligible for consideration in this group of children during Mission Indradhanush?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Japanese Encephalitis JE vaccine is a cell-culture-based, live attenuated vaccine (SA-14-14-2) given as a subcutaneous injection in the left upper arm. It is given in select districts endemic to JE. JE vaccine is given in two doses first dose is given at 9 completed months-12 months of age and the second dose at 16-24 months of age. JE vaccine can be given till 15 years of age.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. DPT is a combined vaccine. DPT 1st dose is given at 16-24 months of age, and DPT 2nd booster dose is given at 5-6 years of age. DPT can be given up to 7 years of age. Option: B. Inactivated Poliomyelitis Vaccine (IPV) is given intradermally at 6 and 14 weeks of age as an intradermal injection at the right upper arm. The first dose can be given up to 1 year of age. Option: C. Vitamin A can be given till 5 years of age.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines uses Thiomersal as a preservative?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

DPT Thiomersal is used as a preservative, and Aluminium hydroxide is used as an adjuvant in DPT. The primary purpose of Thiomersal has been to prevent microbial growth in the product during storage and use. The purpose of aluminium hydroxide in the vaccine is to increase the potency and reduce the tendency to cause reaction

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Stabilizers are compounds added to vaccines to provide stability and maintain immunogenicity. Oral Polio Vaccine is a suspension of type 1 and 3 and is supplied with a stabilizing agent - magnesium chloride. Option: C. BCG is given as an intradermal injection in the left upper arm and uses Sodium Chloride as diluent. Option: D. MR Vaccine is given as a subcutaneous injection in the right upper arm and uses Sterile Water as a diluent.

questions.text: As per the Image shown Below, Vaccine vials opened in the session site can be used in more than one immunization session for up to four weeks provided the following condition. Which of the condition is incorrect

options.label: A
options.text: Vaccines are stored strictly under an appropriate temperature range both during transportation & storage at cold chain point

options.label: B
options.text: The vaccine vial septum has been submerged in water.

options.label: C
options.text: Aseptic technique has been used to withdraw all doses.

options.label: D
options.text: Vaccine vial monitor (VVM). has not reached discard point

questions.correct_answer: B. The vaccine vial septum has been submerged in water.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The vaccine vial septum has been submerged in water. As per Open Vial Policy - Vaccine vials opened in the session site can be used in more than one immunization session up to four weeks provided:- Expiry date has not passed. Vaccines are stored strictly under an appropriate temperature range both during transportation & storage at cold chain points. Vaccine vial septum has not submerged in water or contaminated in any way Aseptic technique has been used to withdraw all doses. Vaccine vial monitor (VVM). has not reached the discard point.

questions.text: “Open vial policy” does not apply to all the following vaccines except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

DPT Open vial policy: •Reuse of partially used multi-dose vials in subsequent session up to four weeks (28 days) PYQ •To reduce vaccine wastage Conditions that must be fulfilled for the use of open vial policy: ✔Date and time mentioned PYQ ✔The expiry date has not passed ✔ Stored under appropriate cold chain conditions ✔ Vaccine vial septum has not been submerged in water or contaminated ✔ Aseptic techniques used to withdraw vaccine doses ✔VVM: has not reached the discard point PYQ Not applicable to: BCG, Measles/MR PYQ , JE, Rotavac, Covishield/covaxin Applicable to: DPT, Td, OPV, IPV, PCV, Hep B, Pentavalent PYQ

questions.text: Which of the following adverse effect of vaccines is wrongly matched:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

IPV: VAPP Vaccine Adverse effect BCG •Suppurative lymphadenitis •BCG osteitis •Disseminated BCG infection Measles/MR/MMR •Febrile seizure •Thrombocytopenia PYQ •Encephalopathy •Toxic shock syndrome PYQ OPV •VAPP (Vaccine-associated paralytic polio) PYQ Pertussis (Whole cell) •Persistent (>3 hours) screaming •Seizures •Hypotonic, hypo responsive episode(HHE) PYQ •Encephalopathy Tetanus toxoid/ Td •Brachial neuritis Rotavac •Intussusception PYQ Influenza (Killed) •Gullain bairre syndrome PYQ Yellow fever (17D) •Vaccine associated viscerotropic disease
